t: Proverbs 1
Purpose and Theme
The*p proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:
for*pn gaining wisdom and instruction; for*ld understanding words of insight;
for*ln receiving instruction in prudent behavior, doing*ld what is right and just and fair;
for*ln giving prudence to those who are simple, knowledge*ld and discretion to the young—
let*ln the wise listen and add to their learning, and*ld let the discerning get guidance—
for*ln understanding proverbs and parables, the*ld sayings and riddles of the wise.
The*pn fear of the Lord*s is the beginning of knowledge, but*ld fools despise wisdom and instruction.
Prologue: Exhortations to Embrace Wisdom
Warning Against the Invitation of Sinful Men
Listen,*pn my son, to your father’s instruction and*ld do not forsake your mother’s teaching.
They*ln are a garland to grace your head and*ld a chain to adorn your neck.
My*pn son, if sinful men entice you, do*ld not give in to them.
If*ln they say, “Come along with us; let’s*ld lie in wait for innocent blood, let’s*ld ambush some harmless soul;
let’s*ln swallow them alive, like the grave, and*ld whole, like those who go down to the pit;
we*ln will get all sorts of valuable things and*ld fill our houses with plunder;
cast*ln lots with us; we*ld will all share the loot”—
my*ln son, do not go along with them, do*ld not set foot on their paths;
for*ln their feet rush into evil, they*ld are swift to shed blood.
How*ln useless to spread a net where*ld every bird can see it!
These*ln men lie in wait for their own blood; they*ld ambush only themselves!
Such*ln are the paths of all who go after ill-gotten gain; it*ld takes away the life of those who get it.
Wisdom’s Rebuke
Out*pn in the open wisdom calls aloud, she*ld raises her voice in the public square;
on*ln top of the wall she cries out, at*ld the city gate she makes her speech:
“How*pn long will you who are simple love your simple ways? How*ld long will mockers delight in mockery and*ld fools hate knowledge?
Repent*ln at my rebuke! Then*ld I will pour out my thoughts to you, I*ld will make known to you my teachings.
But*ln since you refuse to listen when I call and*ld no one pays attention when I stretch out my hand,
since*ln you disregard all my advice and*ld do not accept my rebuke,
I*ln in turn will laugh when disaster strikes you; I*ld will mock when calamity overtakes you—
when*ln calamity overtakes you like a storm, when*ld disaster sweeps over you like a whirlwind, when*ld distress and trouble overwhelm you.
“Then*pn they will call to me but I will not answer; they*ld will look for me but will not find me,
since*ln they hated knowledge and*ld did not choose to fear the Lord.*s
Since*ln they would not accept my advice and*ld spurned my rebuke,
they*ln will eat the fruit of their ways and*ld be filled with the fruit of their schemes.
For*ln the waywardness of the simple will kill them, and*ld the complacency of fools will destroy them;
but*ln whoever listens to me will live in safety and*ld be at ease, without fear of harm.”
